required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Ethanol and Cannabinoid Effects on Simulated Driving and Related Cognition: Sub-Study II
clinical_study.official_title: Ethanol and Cannabinoid Effects on Simulated Driving and Related Cognition: Sub-Study II

brief_summary.textblock: The overarching goal of this study is to characterize the effects of ethanol and cannabinoids on simulated driving and related cognition.

detailed_description.textblock: To study the effects of oral ethanol (target BAC of ~0.04g/dl; equivalent to consuming approximately 2 drinks over 1 hour) and vaporized cannabis (~450 mg cannabis plant material at a THC concentration of ~1.7%; roughly equivalent to smoking approximately 1/4 of a marijuana cigarette, or "joint") on driving.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, +20, +50, +120, +180 mins after start of alcohol administration

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, +20, +50, +120, +180, +240 mins after start of alcohol administration
secondary_outcome.description: A scale designed to assess the stimulant and sedative effects associated with alcohol intoxication

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, +20, +50, +120, +180, +240 mins after start of alcohol administration
secondary_outcome.description: Feeling states associated with alcohol and cannabis intoxication will be measured using this self-report scale of feeling states.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: +40 mins after start of alcohol administration
secondary_outcome.description: Several computer tasks will be administered to assess alcohol and THC effects on driving related cognition, including: visual vigilance, visual motor function, attention and working memory, and processing speed.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, +20, +50, +120, +180, +240 mins after start of alcohol administration
secondary_outcome.description: Subjects will be asked to rate their willingness to drive at their current state in the context of various scenarios including willingness to drive from testing facility to a number of destinations that are different driving distances.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, +20, +50, +120, +180, +240 mins after start of alcohol administration
secondary_outcome.description: Subjects will be asked to rate the number of standard joints that they believe they have been administered.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, +20, +50, +120, +180, +240 mins after start of alcohol administration
secondary_outcome.description: Subjects will be asked to rate the number of standard drinks that they believe they have been administered.

clinical_study.condition: Driving Under the Influence of Alcohol and Other Drugs

intervention.description: ~450 mg of active cannabis, which is roughly equivalent to smoking 1/4 of a marijuana cigarette, or "joint". Administered over 20 minutes via a vaporizer.
Approximately 4 drinks of orange juice or ginger ale covered with a trace amount of ethanol on the surface, each administered over approximately 10 minutes.

0.4 g/kg ethanol in orange juice or ginger ale to reach a target BrAC of approximately 0.04%. This dose is equivalent to approximately 2 standard drinks over 1 hour. Approximately 4 drinks, each administered over approximately 10 minutes.
No active cannabinoids. Administered over 20 minutes via a vaporizer.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Males or females 21 to 55 years of age (extremes included).
- Occasional current cannabis users.
- Experience with drinking 2 or more standard drinks of alcohol at least once in lifetime.
- Able to provide informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Cannabis naïve.
- Alcohol naïve.
- Positive pregnancy screen
- Hearing deficits.

facility.name: Biological Studies Unit, VA Connecticut Healthcare System
